query: most promising AI chip developments for consumer devices 2025

results.query: most promising AI chip developments for consumer devices 2025

results.title: Top 23 AI Chip Makers of 2025 - Statistics & Facts
results.content:
AI chips support various use cases, including image recognition, recommendation engines, natural language processing, and autonomous vehicles.
AI chips are increasingly being used in consumer devices like smartphones, laptops, and wearables, and in enterprise markets such as robotics and sensors.
Nvidia is a leading name in the development of AI chips, with its chips being used to train and run various large language models, including the one developed by OpenAI. [...] Samsung, a major player in the mobile AI chip market, offers its Exynos processors and AI solutions for data centers and edge computing through their Samsung AI chips. Samsung's Exynos processors and AI chips demonstrate their commitment to providing high-performance, efficient solutions for AI tasks on mobile devices and in data centers.
21. Huawei Technologies Co., Ltd. (Ascend) [...] Lightmatter, another emerging company, focuses on developing energy-efficient AI chips. They offer their Envise processor for cloud and edge AI applications. Lightmatter's Envise processor demonstrates their commitment to providing energy-efficient, high-performance solutions for AI tasks in the cloud and edge devices.
15. Qualcomm Incorporated (Snapdragon)

results.title: These are the 10 hottest AI hardware companies to follow in 2025
results.content:
(Image credit: Untether AI)
Untether AI, founded in 2018 and based in Toronto, Canada, specializes in developing high-performance AI chips designed to accelerate AI inference workloads. Its "at-memory" compute architecture minimizes data movement by placing processing elements adjacent to memory, significantly enhancing both efficiency and performance. [...] (Image credit: Blumind)
Blumind, a Canadian analog AI chip startup established in 2020, focuses on creating high-performance, low-power AI solutions for edge computing applications in areas such as wearables, smart home devices, industrial automation, and mobility. [...] (Image credit: Hailo)
Hailo, based in Tel Aviv, Israel, develops what it claims are the world’s best edge AI processors, uniquely designed for high-performance deep learning applications on edge devices.

results.title: 10 top AI hardware and chip-making companies in 2025 - TechTarget
results.content:
Although Qualcomm is relatively new in the AI hardware market compared to its counterparts, its experience in the telecom and mobile sectors makes it a promising competitor. [...] In 2024, the company released Snapdragon 8s Gen 3, a mobile chip. This chip supports 30 AI models and has generative AI features, like image generation and voice assistants.
Qualcomm also launched Snapdragon X Plus, a laptop processor with AI capabilities. This processor rivals competing units as it can have less power use and faster CPU performance.
Tenstorrent [...] Apple Neural Engine, specialized cores based on Apple chips, has furthered the company's AI hardware design and performance. Neural Engine led to the M1 chip for MacBooks. Compared to the generation before, MacBooks with an M1 chip are 3.5 times faster in general performance and five times faster with graphic performance.

6. Alibaba
Alibaba produces chips like Hanguang 800 for inference. However, some North American, European and Australian organizations (e.g. those in the defense industry) may not prefer to use Alibaba Cloud for geopolitical reasons.
7. IBM

results.answer: In 2025, leading AI chip developments for consumer devices include Qualcomm's Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 and Exynos 2400 from Samsung, both offering advanced AI capabilities. Additionally, emerging companies like Untether AI and Blumind are making significant strides in efficient, high-performance AI chips.
